title: Ticket #6108: bosco versions are not build frequently enough
description:
Hi,

The latest bosco version available from

ftp://ftp.cs.wisc.edu/condor/bosco/1.2.6/

is already more than 6 months old and doesn't include the latest bosco changes.

Like for instance this commit

https://github.com/osg-bosco/BLAH/commit/201e3606f4f0d729560fc7673044702ccd8440e4#diff-9bdc8625042afb089f3f3fa49b79d6ef

which is critical for Bosco operations at NERSC (had to manually patch the bosco installation at NERSC).

Cheers

Dirk
remarks:
2017-Jan-24 13:29:45 by jfrey:
The version of the blahp that's available on the ftp site is different than the latest version in the OSG repos, more than just being 6 months old. There appear to be multiple commits regarding blah_job_wrapper that would need to be added.

2017-Jan-25 18:09:22 by hufnagel:
Wouldn't it make sense to just use a single blah repository for both projects ?

2017-Jan-26 10:22:15 by jfrey:
Yes. We plan to do that for HTCondor 8.7.x.

2017-Jun-26 14:55:42 by jfrey:
The version of Bosco available on the ftp site is based on the latest stable release of HTCondor from UW-Madison.
